info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 07 at 8:35PM EST until March 12 at 9:24AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... Wabash River near Linn Grove affecting Adams and Wells Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING TO LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Wabash River near Linn Grove. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning to late Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Secondary roads are blocked. Roads near the east side of Geneva begin to flood. Some evacuations may be required and property needs to be transferred to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM EST Monday the stage was 10.2 feet and slowly rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 13.1 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
